item.title: 2 Samuel 1
item.description: v1 After the death of Saul, when David had returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had stayed two days in Ziklag;

item.title: 2 Samuel 2
item.description: v1 After this, David inquired of Yahweh, saying, “Shall I go up into any of the cities of Judah?

item.title: 2 Samuel 3
item.description: v1 Now there was long war between Saul’s house and David’s house.

item.title: 2 Samuel 4
item.description: v1 When Saul’s son heard that Abner was dead in Hebron, his hands became feeble, and all the Israelites were troubled.

item.title: 2 Samuel 5
item.description: v1 Then all the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron, and spoke, saying, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.

item.title: 2 Samuel 6
item.description: v1 David again gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand.

item.title: 2 Samuel 7
item.description: v1 When the king lived in his house, and Yahweh had given him rest from all his enemies all around,

item.title: 2 Samuel 8
item.description: v1 After this, David struck the Philistines and subdued them; and David took the bridle of the mother city out of the hand of the Philistines.

item.title: 2 Samuel 9
item.description: v1 David said, “Is there yet any who is left of Saul’s house, that I may show him kindness for Jonathan’s sake?

item.title: 2 Samuel 10
item.description: v1 After this, the king of the children of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his place.

item.title: 2 Samuel 11
item.description: v1 At the return of the year, at the time when kings go out, David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the children of Ammon, and besieged Rabbah.

item.title: 2 Samuel 12
item.description: v1 Yahweh sent Nathan to David. He came to him, and said to him, “There were two men in one city; the one rich, and the other poor.

item.title: 2 Samuel 13
item.description: v1 After this, Absalom the son of David had a beautiful sister, whose name was Tamar; and Amnon the son of David loved her.

item.title: 2 Samuel 14
item.description: v1 Now Joab the son of Zeruiah perceived that the king’s heart was toward Absalom.

item.title: 2 Samuel 15
item.description: v1 After this, Absalom prepared a chariot and horses for himself, and fifty men to run before him.

item.title: 2 Samuel 16
item.description: v1 When David was a little past the top, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him with a couple of donkeys saddled, and on them two hundred loaves of bread, and one hundred clusters of raisins, and one hundred summer fruits, and a container of wine.

item.title: 2 Samuel 17
item.description: v1 Moreover Ahithophel said to Absalom, “Let me now choose twelve thousand men, and I will arise and pursue after David tonight.

item.title: 2 Samuel 18
item.description: v1 David counted the people who were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.

item.title: 2 Samuel 19
item.description: v1 Joab was told, “Behold, the king weeps and mourns for Absalom.

item.title: 2 Samuel 20
item.description: v1 There happened to be there a wicked fellow, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite; and he blew the trumpet, and said, “We have no portion in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse.

item.title: 2 Samuel 21
item.description: v1 There was a famine in the days of David for three years, year after year; and David sought the face of Yahweh.

item.title: 2 Samuel 22
item.description: v1 David spoke to Yahweh the words of this song in the day that Yahweh delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul,

item.title: 2 Samuel 23
item.description: v1 Now these are the last words of David. David the son of Jesse says, the man who was raised on high says, the anointed of the God of Jacob, the sweet psalmist of Israel:

item.title: 2 Samuel 24
item.description: v1 Again Yahweh’s anger burned against Israel, and he moved David against them, saying, “Go, count Israel and Judah.
